line_1: Our fields in civil blood imbrued?
line_2: Say, was it thus, when late we view'd

line_1: These jaws, in slaughter oft imbru'd,
line_2: At length, have known enough of blood;

line_1: From his fell gripe, whose hands in blood imbrued,
line_2: One sickly lamp the wretched master shewed;

line_1: From his fell gripe, whose hands in blood imbrued,
line_2: In his own bosom seek his lacerated food?

line_1: Already is his forked tongue imbrued
line_2: O'er her fair breast to suck her vital blood;

line_1: Already is his forked tongue imbrued
line_2: Warm in the stream of life, her heart's pure purple flood.

line_1: But where his Lance the Field with Blood imbru'd,
line_2: Swift as he mov'd, Hydrocharis pursu'd,

line_1: Behold her torch in gall imbrued:
line_2: Behold — her garments drop with blood

line_1: For lo! these Hands in Murther are imbru'd;
line_2: These trembling Feet by Justice are pursu'd:

line_1: The pointed Dagger, deep in Rage imbru'd:
line_2: But, in her Hand, tho' half conceal'd, is view'd,
